title: Message to the Boy Scouts of America.
text:
To the Boy Scouts of America: Boy Scout Week gives all of us an opportunity to honor the two million, seven hundred and sixty-five thousand boys and their nearly one million leaders who make up this great organization. Self-development and service to others, independence and good citizenship, a sense of brotherhood and responsiveness to spiritual values--these qualities which Scouting fosters mean much to America. To all Boy Scouts I extend congratulations on what they are achieving and on what they promise for our nation's future.

DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER
